snippet: The apparent collapse of Mt. Gox, the most prominent Bitcoin exchange, late Monday night stirred ire, but also hope for the virtual currency. | A Senate report says Credit Suisse helped American clients hide billions in assets. | Bank of America i...
lead_paragraph: BITCOIN’S SILVER LINING  |  The apparent collapse of Mt. Gox, the most prominent Bitcoin exchange, late Monday night naturally stirred outrage and panic. After all, a document circulating widely in the Bitcoin world said the company had lost 744,000 Bitcoins — about 6 percent of Bitcoins in circulation — worth more than $300 million at current exchange rates. But Bitcoin’s latest troubles did little to shake the confidence of many, and indeed, the virtual currency’s stumble may provide just the spark it needs to become a more mature part of the financial system, Nathaniel Popper and Rachel Abrams write in DealBook.

headline.main: A Silver Lining in Bitcoin’s Stumble
